p: Bone marrow MSCs appeared as fibroblastic and spindle-shaped (Figure 1A). The cultured MSCs were positive for the presence of surface markers CD44 and CD29 but not CD45 (Figure 1A, B, C). However, the ACs exhibited an amoeboid and squamous-shaped cells in the monolayer culture (Figure 1D) with only type-II collagen and proteoglycan expression (Figure 1D, E, F). MSCs and ACs displayed spherical-shaped morphology in 3D culture. Upon reaching 21 days of culture in chondrogenic medium, MSC and AC-alginate beads expressed proteoglycan and type-II collagen as observed from the histological analysis.
